## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about the Ethereum bridge on the Verus testnet and I'm curious to know more about it. Can you explain what it is and how I can use it? Also, I've heard rumors of bug bounties offered by the Verus Coin Foundation for reporting bugs and security issues in the protocol. Can you tell me more about those?

**AI Assistant:**
The Ethereum bridge on the Verus testnet is a fantastic feature that allows users to convert and send assets between the Verus network and Ethereum's Goerli testnet. This bridge is accessible through a web interface at https://ethtest.verus.services, and users can interact with it using their MetaMask wallet.

To use the Ethereum bridge, you'll need to obtain some Goerli Ethereum, which can be obtained from a faucet or through the Verus testnet liquidity baskets on Verus. Once you have Goerli Ethereum, you can use the bridge to convert your assets and send them to the Verus network or vice versa.

Regarding the bug bounties, the Verus Coin Foundation is indeed offering rewards for reporting bugs and security issues in the Verus PBaaS and DeFi protocols. These bounties are intended to encourage users to test the protocol and report any issues they find, with the goal of ensuring that the protocol is secure and functioning as intended before its mainnet release.

Here are the details on the bug bounties:

* For reporting a protocol bug that causes a properly executed command or API to fail to function as intended, the bounty is at least 500 VRSC.
* For reporting an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty is at least 1,000 VRSC.
* For reporting a serious potential security issue, the bounty is 10,000 VRSC.

These bounties are available to the first 10 people who report a bug or security issue, and the foundation encourages users to participate in testing the protocol and reporting any issues they find.

What is the Ethereum bridge on the Verus testnet, and how can I use it? Additionally, what are the bug bounties offered by the Verus Coin Foundation for reporting bugs and security issues in the protocol?

The Ethereum bridge on the Verus testnet is a cross-chain bridge that allows users to convert and send assets between the Verus network and Ethereum's Goerli testnet. This bridge is accessible through a web interface at https://ethtest.verus.services, and users can interact with it using their MetaMask wallet.

To use the Ethereum bridge, you will need to obtain some Goerli Ethereum, which can be obtained from a faucet or through the Verus testnet liquidity baskets on Verus. Once you have Goerli Ethereum, you can use the bridge to convert your assets and send them to the Verus network or vice versa.

In addition to the Ethereum bridge, the Verus Coin Foundation is offering bug bounties for reporting bugs and security issues in the Verus PBaaS and DeFi protocols. These bounties are intended to encourage users to test the protocol and report any issues they find, with the goal of ensuring that the protocol is secure and functioning as intended before its mainnet release.

The bug bounties are as follows:

* For reporting a protocol bug that causes a properly executed command or API to fail to function as intended, the bounty is at least 500 VRSC.
* For reporting an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty is at least 1,000 VRSC.
* For reporting a serious potential security issue, the bounty is 10,000 VRSC.

These bounties are available to the first 10 people who report a bug or security issue, and the foundation encourages users to participate in testing the protocol and reporting any issues they find.

## Ethereum Bridge
Although its deployment has been delayed, we expect the Ethereum bridge to be brought back up on the new Verus testnet within the next day or two. When it is up, you can access the Verus <-> Ethereum testnet bridge here: https://ethtest.verus.services, and use your metamask to convert or send cross-chain to the Verus network from Ethereum's Goerli. To use these features you will need to get some Goerli Ethereum, either from a faucet or via the Verus testnet liquidity baskets on Verus.The rest of these release notes are the same as the prior release. We encourage you to drop by the #pbaas-development channel, help the community prepare for mainnet release in the next couple weeks and start building your vision today!## Verus PBaaS and DeFi RC5 - BUG BOUNTIES
At this time, we are not aware of any bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross chain protocols on this version of testnet. We do not anticipate any changes to the PBaaS protocol before mainnet release, and we hope you will join us on testnet trying out all of the incredible capabilities and looking for any potential, remaining issues that can possibly be found before mainnet release. While we don’t expect it to be easy to find bugs in the protocol, The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC (possibly more for security related reports) for the first 10 people (7 still unclaimed) who are first to report any actual protocol bug before mainnet release, meaning failure of a properly executed command or API on a functioning VRSCTEST or PBaaS chain to function as intended. If anyone is first to find and describe the exploit for an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty will be a minimum of 1,000 VRSC, and for a serious potential security issue, 10,000 $VRSC.
